entry.title: Basic concepts and features of the Cloudburo Curation Platform
entry.content:
The article describes the basic concepts and capability of the Cloudburo Curation Platform in a narrative way. It will allow you to get a good overview what is offered by the platform.

An Online Content site for your community

The
Cloudburo Curation Platform is managing content sites of multiple
users.

A Cloudburo
content
site consists of multiple
articles which were transformed from Evernote
notes stored in dedicated Evernote
notebooks.

A content site is offering the articles in a r esponsive mobile friendly HTML format to the online audience which provides in an optimized reading experience on any device size.

A content site is represented by a unique user chosen
site identifier
(SID) within the Cloudburo Curation Platform. You may manage multiple sites from one Evernote account.

By default the content side of a user is reachable via https://<yourSiteId>.curation.space. You may choose to use your own domain.

A blog article may be originated from a note which was placed in one of two Evernote transfer
notebooks.

A set of Evernote Notebooks will manage the content creation process

  • Notes which are self-created or curated, that means they are formatted and structured according to the authors desire. These notes should be placed into the Curation Transfer Notebook. It has the name <yourSiteId>-E-CurateGen.
  • Notes which consist of a short news headline paragraph in bold complemented with a link to the full article on a third party website should be placed into the News Transfer Notebook. It has the name <yourSiteId>-D-NewsGen.
Notes in the transfer notebooks will be periodically fetched by the Cloudburo Curation Platform, converted to articles and published on the users content site.

After the note is published it will be moved to the Evernote
Archive Notebook with the name
<yourSiteId-Z-Archiv). The note will be marked with the tag
clb-processed.

For the news style content kind of notes a text expander convience feature is provided
  • Any news notes (with a external link) placed in the notebook <yourSiteId>-A-NewsGen will trigger a full content fetch by the curation platform from the provided notes link.
  • the extracted content will be stored in plain text as the note content
  • finally the note will be moved into the notebook <yourSiteId>-B-Prepare.

This feature will allow you to speed up article publishing on news site, refer to the workflow description for details

Evernote notes are the foundation of your published articles

The Evernote note
creation date as well as the note
title should be treated as immutable after the initial article generation step. These two attributes are part of the article URL and will uniquely identify the article in your content site.

Changing these two fields will result in a new article entry. Otherwise an change on a processed note and moving it back into the Transfer Notebook will result in a updated article.

A generated article can be removed from the content site, by attaching the
clb-delete tag and move it to one of the Transfer Notebooks. The note will be fetched and the corresponding article will be removed from the content site. The note itself will be moved to the Archive Notebook and the clb-delete tag will be unattached.

A note may have dedicated tags attached with a prefix of “<site identifier>-<category>”. The tags will be used to categorize the articles on the content site. The content site will offer a category menu which lists all used categories in oder to get a list of articles by category entty.

Fine tune the publishing periodicity according to your needs

A content site is operated in a user chosen
time zone and notes in the Transfer notebooks are members of the
article publishing queue. The article publishing queue has a article
publishing scheduler, which defines (user chosen)
  • at which week days
  • in which time window in the defined time zone
  • how many articles per hour
should be published on the content site.

If the publish scheduler triggers a generation event, the above described transfer notebooks will be checked for available notes. If available the scheduler will fetch the oldest note (creation date) and generate the corresponding content site article.

For notes with the tag clb-processed or clb-delete attached the scheduler doesn’t apply - i.e. they will be updated or deleted in the next publishing cycle.

Embed various kind of rich content artifacts

You may include various kind of content which will be nicely formatted in a resposnive manner in your content site
  • Images
  • Youtube Videos
  • Code Synax Highlighting
  • HTML direct Embed. To be used in cases you want to include any kind of HTML code fragements. I.e. in case you want include a Mailchimp form for your newsletter

Control content site menu and footer, as well as social media icon links

Additional Header- as well as Footer menus, as well as optionally a customized entry (index) page, may be defined in dedicated Evernote notes. Socia media icons to link to your social media sites are available.

A rich set of integration options exists to further customize and extend your content site

Various possibilities exist to integrate your content site with other capabilities, as for example
  • Google Analytics
  • Disqus Comment and Collaboration feature
  • RSS Feed support

The following naming conventions apply for the above mentioned Evernote Notebooks, they will be automatically created (as well as any required tag) during the initial setup of a site.
  • blog-<site identifier>-A-Fetch
  • blog-<site identifier>-B-Prepare
  • blog-<site identifier>-D-NewsGen
  • blog-<side identifier>-E-CurateGen
  • blog-<side identifier>-Z-Archive

entry.title: Credit Card Payments Handling at Cloudburo
entry.content:
Security is one of our biggest consideration, when it comes down to charge our client for our services via Credit or Debit Card.

Therefore Cloudburo choses Stripe as our Payment provider for handling any kind of credit card transaction. Stripe is a leading and trusted payment processor in the internet space.

Stripe has been audited by a PCI-certified auditor, and is certified to PCI Service Provider Level 1. This is the most stringent level of certification available.

We use Stripe.js on our website to collect the necessary credit card data in your browser. The entered data in the form is never sent to our server, instead they are sent directly to Stripe.

Why is this so important?

  • More secure because a breach of our servers won’t result in any stolen credit card data. They are only hold in the highly secure vaults of Stripe, which fully complies to the PCI standard.
  • Therefore we are automatically also PCI compliant because we don’t handle any sensitive credit card data on our servers.

Serving you with a premium service experience and ensuring highest protection of your sensitive data.

entry.title: Showcase: Visitor Tips for Hotel Guest
entry.content:
The Website zurich4u.ch is used by the owners of a small but fine Swiss boutique and design hotel chain in Zurich/Switzerland ( Townhouse, Plattenhof ) to offer mobile optimized content around Zurich for their hotel clientele.


The Website is concentrating around quick tips what to do in Zurich grouped by the categories ‚shopping‘, ‚restaurant‘, ‚leisure‘, ‚coffee&bar‘, as well as ‚art‘.

The owner can produce these personalized recommendation quickly just by using Evernote on any kind of device, whenever there is a free time slot. Be it in the office, at home or visiting one of its hotels or restaurants.


Aiming a hotel guests and tourists strolling through the city, it’s key that the content is mobile site optimized.


Having - beside the official hotel web sites - an additional self curated content site with tips around the travel destination (which gets updated regularly with fresh content), helps in attracting new prospects and clients in the Internet in a indirect way.

As for example: „Grieder Bar“ is a new and hype place in Zurich which attracts people living or visiting Zurich. The hotel owner of zurich4u was publishing a small article on its Website about this trendy place.

Now checking google search shows that this article is already shown on the first search page!


This will lead people first to the content Website and from there potentially to the Hotel Websites, which ultimately may result in new clients and new revenue.

An easy solution in order to establish a presence in the Content Marketing space, affordable and manageable for any kind of companies.

entry.title: Feature: Custom Domain Support and Cloudflare CDN Integration
entry.content:
As top level domain for our content sites we use the domain „curation.space“

Your personal default subdomain: <siteId>.curation.space

The .space domain name is described as follow by the Website domain.com

.SPACE is the domain name for passionate and driven individuals who are ready to carve out their place online. .SPACE is a canvas for self-starters to express their creativity and share their talents with the world.
.SPACE provides a solid anchor for creative minds to explore infinite possibilities and to define their ideas online. It specially caters to freelancers, professionals, and hobbyists who want to showcase their skills and highlight their commitment to their passions.

This suits quite well with the goal of the Cloudburo Curation Platform to drive an support passionate and driven indivduals and professionals in building their content space.
During the registration process you will choose your <sitedId> (e.g. myblog). The Curation Platform will create the subdomain <sitedId>.curation.space (e.g. myblog.curation.space) for you. No other content except the one created by you will be placed there. So choose your name wisely.

Use your own domain name

You can use your own domain name instead of the one offered by us. Configure your CNAME in the Curation Platform Admin GUI, e.g. dognews.mydomain.com and configure a CNAME entry in your domain name server pointing to acloudburo.github.io.


curation.space domain is protected and acclerated by Cloudflare CDN

In front of our Content site we have the Cloudflare Content Delivery Network. As part of the CloudFlare community, our web traffic is routed through their intelligent global network. Cloudflare automatically optimize the delivery of our web pages so your visitors get the fastest page load times and best performance. They also block threats and limit abusive bots and crawlers from wasting our bandwidth and server resources. The result: CloudFlare-powered websites see a significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks.

By using Cloudflare we also enabled by default the secure https:// protocol (the new de facto standard for websites).


We are leveraging for the content site publishing the global Web backbone of github.io (via their gh-pages facility).
This allows us good performance and high availability of the content sites.
